channel.title: Internal IP Update Documentation?
channel.description:
Patrick does the documentation have to be updated on the wiki because the internal network IP has changed?
For example should we tell people to just use 0.0.0.0 on the onioncat and VOIP pages?

item.title: Internal IP Update Documentation?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
HulaHoop:

Patrick does the documentation have to be updated on the wiki because the internal network IP has changed?

When Whonix 9 gets released, I have a note here to remember doing this:

Whonix – 19 Mar 20

Dev/Redistribution - Whonix

Design Documentation about Redistribution of Whonix ™


Will then change it using the mass search and replace extension (https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Extension:Replace_Text) to save manual work.

Ideally it would be best if one could click a button 8 or 9 in the wiki, and wiki pages will then show versions specific to that version. However, I searched with fortasse for a solution, also asked on mediawiki list, but there is no solution.

HulaHoop:

For example should we tell people to just use 0.0.0.0 on the onioncat and VOIP pages?

No, I don’t think 0.0.0.0 should be encouraged. At least in custom setups with additional (virtual) network cards it could do something unexpected.

Read full topic
